Flying from Lisbon to Marseilles
January 15, 1940
Dear Family:
I left Baltimore Last sunday,
January Ith, on the American Clipper.
arrived at Bermuda after a
fast flight of
only four
and one half
arrival we learned that high seas at our next stop,
Azores, prevented a landing there.
So we stayed over in Bermuda.
weather at Horta.
her at tertays de dia a lot he bicycling at
for better
bicycLing at Bernar and one atterode
twenty miles. My legs felt like a toe-dancer's look!

llth we left for Horta and flew all night,

January
13th,
the weather

a result I had two
at Horta,
worked out well for me because

or coming back.
We left Horta on the morning of the
arrived at Lisbon
4:00 o'clock in the afternoon.
I was met
an old friend from
Macao,
Lieut. Costa,
of course, was
night, or rather morning,

our Lisbon
and wrote a

flying it a french airplane

airplane

left Lisbon an hour ago and
soon we'll fly by Gibraltar
Oran, Algeria.
It seems ridiculous to fly from Lisbon to Marseilles
via Africa,
secure rights to fly over Spain and
avoid doing so while yet connecting Algeria with France.
Our Captain is the best
cormercial pilot in France and
pilot
serves as chief
for all
the French companies.
He has
also flown
several times
across the Atlantic.
Our plane is a very
comfortable 15
seater (held
the mail load to only five passengers) trimotored, all metal

His father
in Switzerland.
He fought for

Another
passenger
is from St. Louis - where he has lived for several years - connected with
the Shell Petroleum
Corporation.
His name is William F. Court.
Shell man
from the East
a representative of the Gruman Aircraft
pany complete the list.
Now, at 9:45, we have just flown over Cadiz (our French pilot doesn't
seem to have
too much respect for the soverignty of Spain), with Seville
off in the distance, well back from the coast.
Then we passed Gibraltar
